modules.name: Node.Stream
modules.comments: This module provides a low-level wrapper for the Node Stream API.

declarations.comments:
A stream.

The type arguments track, in order:

- Whether reading and/or writing from/to the stream are allowed.
- Effects associated with reading/writing from/to this stream.
declarations.title: Stream

declarations.comments: A phantom type associated with _readable streams_.
declarations.title: Read

declarations.comments: A readable stream.
declarations.title: Readable

declarations.comments: A phantom type associated with _writable streams_.
declarations.title: Write

declarations.comments: A writable stream.
declarations.title: Writable

declarations.comments: A duplex (readable _and_ writable stream)
declarations.title: Duplex

declarations.comments:
Listen for `data` events, returning data in a Buffer. Note that this will fail
if `setEncoding` has been called on the stream.
declarations.title: onData

declarations.comments:
Listen for `data` events, returning data in a String, which will be
decoded using the given encoding. Note that this will fail if `setEncoding`
has been called on the stream.
declarations.title: onDataString

declarations.comments:
Listen for `data` events, returning data in an `Either String Buffer`. This
function is provided for the (hopefully rare) case that `setEncoding` has
been called on the stream.
declarations.title: onDataEither

declarations.comments:
Set the encoding used to read chunks as strings from the stream. This
function may be useful when you are passing a readable stream to some other
JavaScript library, which already expects an encoding to be set.

Where possible, you should try to use `onDataString` instead of this
function.
declarations.title: setEncoding

declarations.comments: Listen for `readable` events.
declarations.title: onReadable

declarations.comments: Listen for `end` events.
declarations.title: onEnd

declarations.comments: Listen for `close` events.
declarations.title: onClose

declarations.comments: Listen for `error` events.
declarations.title: onError

declarations.comments: Resume reading from the stream.
declarations.title: resume

declarations.comments: Pause reading from the stream.
declarations.title: pause

declarations.comments: Check whether or not a stream is paused for reading.
declarations.title: isPaused

declarations.comments: Read chunks from a readable stream and write them to a writable stream.
declarations.title: pipe

declarations.comments: Write a Buffer to a writable stream.
declarations.title: write

declarations.comments: Write a string in the specified encoding to a writable stream.
declarations.title: writeString

declarations.comments: Force buffering of writes.
declarations.title: cork

declarations.comments: Flush buffered data.
declarations.title: uncork

declarations.comments:
Set the default encoding used to write strings to the stream. This function
is useful when you are passing a writable stream to some other JavaScript
library, which already expects a default encoding to be set. It has no
effect on the behaviour of the `writeString` function (because that
function ensures that the encoding is always supplied explicitly).
declarations.title: setDefaultEncoding

declarations.comments: End writing data to the stream.
declarations.title: end
